column4: i've herd of too many problems at this point.  I'll stay on dapper :)
question:  anyone know of a batch interface to lame?  gui would be nice, but I'm comfortable enough at the prompt :)
just write one yourself, its quite fun...
i know some scripting, but no where near skilled enough yet to do it as a bash or nautilius script yet :(
me neather and i did it... wait...
i assume, also, i'd have to learn to use something to read out id3 tags, to preserve them.  not sure of a command line tool to do that
i did not do tags... here is how i did it from mp4 http://paste.ubuntu-nl.org/32024/
pacpl is a nice perl audio converter... try to install it
ahh, i wanted something to basically 'downmix' my mp3s.  the MP3 cd player at work, as well as the one in my car, don't handle anything but 128cbr files well (i encode to 224vbs usually)
i take it that app isn't in the repositories?
so just use ... lame -h -b 128 file.wav file.mp3
yes, that would be fine... except when theres nearly 300 songs to convert... one by one... by hand...
thats why you do for i in *.mp3 do lame... etc etc
first test it with a few copied files
you can learn loads from this script http://paste.ubuntu-nl.org/32030/
you are a godsend, I can figure it out from that easily :)
i think so... where they use ffmpeg... you just use lame
